1.title: Lyfestyle Clothing
1.subtitle: It’s our goal to produce quality clothing that embodies our inspirations of the moment. We only source premium fabrics, usually directly from NYC's garment district. All of our cut and sewn garments are made at our Brooklyn factory. We strive to build a strong brand by consistently making quality clothing that our customers can be proud to wear.

products.name: Taffy Multicolor Lyfestyle Sweatsuit
products.description: Chenille Patch. True to Size. Made in Brooklyn. Available in other colors.

products.name: Multicolor Turtleneck Lyfestyle Dresses
products.description: Chenille Patch. 94.5% Rayon / 5.5% Spandex. Fitted. Sewn in Brooklyn

products.name: Serpent Lyfestyle Hoody
products.description: 8oz Mid-Weight Fleece. Velvet Print. True to Size. Printed in Brooklyn

1.title: Bossa Bars
1.subtitle: Energy bars formulated for women perimenopause to post to help support daily nutritional needs and keep that sneaky extra 10 pounds under control!

2.title: Ka'oir Fitness
2.subtitle: Ka'oir Fitness, founded in 2011 by celebrity Keyshia Ka'oir is a fitness line of patented, trademarked fat burners to help people lose weight faster than ever.

products.name: Ka'oir Waist Eraser™
products.description: Ka'oir Waist Eraser™ will have your waist, stomach & back looking amazing. This is a unisex fitness product which burns belly & back fat, sheds excess water and shrinks waist size....all while allowing your abs to be more visible. It allows you to spot train your stomach, back  & waist.

products.name: Ka'oir Body Sweat™
products.description: The Ka'oir Body Sweat is a state of the art "sweat" suit. It is very stretchy, flexible & comfortable for any workout. KA'OIR Body Sweat will make you sweat tremendously, your metabolism will increase, you will burn calories, lose weight & shed water!

products.name: Ka'oir Slimming Tea
products.description: KA’OIR Slimming Tea is a loose leaf tea packed in individual nylon tea bags that contains a powerful blend of natural ingredients to help slim your body! Each package includes 14 bags (78.4 grams) of detox tea, and is meant to be used every day or every other day.

2.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
2.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

3.title: Open Yale Courses: African American History: From Emancipation to the Present
3.subtitle: The purpose of this course is to examine the African American experience in the United States from 1863 to the present. Prominent themes include the end of the Civil War and the beginning of Reconstruction; African Americans’ urbanization experiences; the development of the modern civil rights movement and its aftermath; and the thought and leadership of Booker T. Washington, Ida B. Wells-Barnett, W.E.B. Du Bois, Marcus Garvey, Martin Luther King Jr., and Malcolm X.

3.title: Gentleman AF
3.subtitle: Gentleman AF is a beard care line featuring a beard wash, beard oils, and beard balms for classy men with a dash of savagery.

products.name: Beard Balms
products.description: Scoop a dime sized amount of beard balm with your finger and place it in the palm of your hands. Rub it between both palms until it melts. Apply it to your beard, comb it down and style as desired.

products.name: Beard Wash
products.description: Wet your face and neck, place a small amount of beard wash in the palm of your hands and massage it into your beard and face, including your neck. Rinse your beard thoroughly.

products.name: Beard Oils
products.description: Shake well before use. Drop a dime sized amount of beard oil in the palm of your hands. Rub your hands and apply the oil from your skin to the tip of your beard.

4.title: Beyond the Numbers: The Experiential Effects of Stereotype Threat on Students of Color at TCU
4.subtitle: This study aims to examine if and how the effects of negative stereotypes of students of color are felt beyond the statistical measures of academic success, reaching into the classroom and social experiences of these students.

4.title: Why Protests and Riots Work
4.subtitle: Riots are destructive, dangerous, and scary — but can lead to serious social reforms. To prevent more violent uprisings and protests, we need to take their causes seriously.

5.title: Sha'Carri Richardson's drug test suspension is the end result of racist policies
5.subtitle: Sha’Carri Richardson should have been spending the next month preparing to win the Olympic gold medal in the 100-meter dash. She had a shot after blazing through the event’s qualifying race last month in under 11 seconds. Instead, Richardson may not get to run at all in Tokyo after failing a drug test taken during the Olympic trials in Oregon. But it wasn’t a performance-enhancer that was in her system: It was marijuana.

5.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
5.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

6.title: Stay Informed: Ma'Khia Bryant Shooting
6.subtitle: A teenage girl who the police say threatened two girls with a knife was fatally shot by an officer in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, April 20th, 2021, shortly before a jury reached a guilty verdict in the murder trial of the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in last year’s killing of George Floyd.

6.title: Blow Candle Co.
6.subtitle: Blow Candle Co. is a company on a mission to support and uplift women! A grief hobby turned empowerment project, Blow is carrying on the legacy of my late brother DaVaughn, who’s lifelong duty was to help and encourage others.

products.name: Signature Collection
products.description: Introducing our Signature Collection! Seven carefully curated scents to inspire, relax and delight! Our candles are made from an all natural coconut wax blend, phthalate and paraben free fragrances and eco friendly, cotton braided wicks for a clean burn.

products.name: The Essence Collection
products.description: A collection of deep and complex fragrance blends. An ode to Womxn, everywhere.

products.name: Signature Collection
products.description: These sweet little wax truffles last 3-5 days per piece depending on the average time of use.

7.title: Buttaz & Wax
7.subtitle: Buttaz & Wax is a handcrafted body butter and personal care line that came about after founder Keisha Marie made one of her body butters and her eight year old daughter looked up at her and said "mommy these are good, you should sell them".

products.name: Coco Loco Body Butter
products.description: Apply to any area of the body as needed. Best used after a shower when skin is still a bit damp. The butters and oils will lock moisture from shower into your skin.

products.name: Beard Oil
products.description: Work 3-5 drops of our beard oil into your hair revive your beard. Best used right after a shower while your beard is still damp

products.name: Lavender Soap
products.description: Our Lavender handcrafted soap, just like our Lavender bathsalts, smells like calming Lavender.

7.title: Smell Good Spa
7.subtitle: Established in 1998, we are purveyors of aromatic products for women who are making a conscientious change in their personal care products. Our products are the cherry-on-top for women who love to live good, feel good and smell good, wholesomely.

8.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
8.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

8.title: Pod For The Cause Podcast
8.subtitle: The Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights launched "Pod for the Cause" to expand the conversation on the critical civil and human rights challenges of our day. Through this expanded dialogue, we want to spur activism that drives change in our communities and country.

9.title: Free Minds Book Club
9.subtitle: Change lives today. Donate now to support incarcerated and formerly incarcerated youths and adults.

9.title: Swimming caps designed for natural hair banned from Tokyo Olympic Games
9.subtitle: Swimming caps designed for natural Black hair — and created by a Black-owned company — will not be allowed at the upcoming Olympic Games in Tokyo. The International Swimming Federation said the caps do not follow "the natural form of the head," British brand Soul Cap told BBC News.

10.title: Corner 103

products.name: NV Sparkling Rosé
products.description: This Gold Medal winning wine was made in the classic French style using traditional grapes; making it non-vintage; and using the methode champenoise process which requires a secondary fermentation in the bottle.

products.name: 2018 Chardonnay, Sonoma Carneros
products.description: Our 2018 Chardonnay was crafted from a low-yielding vineyard in the Carneros AVA that consistently produces some of the region's best Chardonnay grapes.

products.name: 2017 Grenache, Alexander Valley
products.description: Our 2017 Grenache is a balanced wine crafted from an amazing low yielding vineyard in the Alexander Valley that consistently delivers excellent fruit flavors and silky tannins.

10.title: NCMPRBL

11.subtitle: Learn about Julius’ life and what led to his wrongful conviction through Viola Davis' docu-series "The Last Defense."

13.title: White Fragility: Why It's So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism
13.subtitle: This book explicates the dynamics of White Fragility and how we might build our capacity in the on-going work towards racial justice.

14.title: What Happened on May 25th?
14.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

14.title: Black Beard Brigade Men's Grooming Co.

products.shopName: Black Beard Brigade Men's Grooming Co.

products.name: Premium Classic Beard Oil

products.shopName: Black Beard Brigade Men's Grooming Co.

15.title: The Collective PAC
15.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

15.subtitle: It is Nicole R. Brown's desire that Ruth Nathan’s does not only make customers look spectacular but feel spectacular as well, positively influencing them to feel better about themselves. It is a known fact that when one dresses well, one feels better—and from an outfit that is well put together, that makes one walk with pride, the Urban Peacock emerges.

products.name: Blue Curved Mask
products.description: Still want to look dapper while protecting yourself and others? We have the answer! Reusable and re-washable, these fabric masks will keep you looking good and doing good. When you buy a curved face mask from Ruth Nathan’s we donate a rectangular face mask to health care professionals and essential workers in need.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
products.description: The deep older brother of the Franc Un pattern, the Franc Bleu’s watercolor pen lines convey elegance and a truly historic sense of style. Also inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Bleu carries notes of art deco, dancing under the stars, and midnight.

16.title: Color blind or color brave?
16.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

products.name: Headwrap - Suto

products.name: Hidden in Ocho Rios | Art Print

17.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
17.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

17.title: Sienna Sauce

18.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

18.title: Martin Luther King Jr.’s ‘Letter From Birmingham Jail’
18.subtitle: In April 1963, King was jailed in Birmingham, Alabama. While there, he wrote a lengthy letter in the margins of a newspaper, and smuggled it out with the help of his lawyer. The eloquent call for “constructive, nonviolent tension” to force an end to unjust laws became a landmark document of the civil-rights movement.

21.title: Aloha Glamour
21.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

22.title: A.O. Hamer
22.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

22.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
22.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

23.title: Ashay by the Bay
23.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

products.name: Hollow Core Paddle Board Frame Kits

products.name: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hat

24.title: Seven factors that contribute to American racism
24.subtitle: Of the seven factors the researchers identified, perhaps the most insidious is passivism or passive racism, which includes an apathy toward systems of racial advantage or denial that those systems even exist.

24.title: How we're priming some kids for college — and others for prison
24.subtitle: In the United States, two institutions guide teenagers on the journey to adulthood: college and prison. Sociologist Alice Goffman spent six years in a troubled Philadelphia neighborhood and saw first-hand how teenagers of African-American and Latino backgrounds are funneled down the path to prison — sometimes starting with relatively minor infractions. In an impassioned talk she asks, "Why are we offering only handcuffs and jail time?"

25.title: AuxGod
25.subtitle: AUXGOD is a music battle card game that Rousseau created six months after quitting his job. Players dance, sing, and argue over yesterday’s classics and today’s hits. You’ll never have a wack party again!

25.subtitle: Get thousands of Black-owned businesses at your fingertips with the largest online platform for Black businesses.

26.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
26.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

26.title: The Sentencing Project
26.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

29.title: Juneteenth Challenges A Narrative About America’s History
29.subtitle: Juneteenth marks the day in 1865 when Union troops arrived in Galveston, Texas, and the enslaved people living there learned of their freedom — more than two years after President Abraham Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation. As such, the day tells a broader story of how emancipation was woefully delayed for Black people enslaved deep in the Confederacy.

29.title: Ujamaa Lighting
29.subtitle: Although light bulbs are considered a commodity, the Ujamaa Lighting brand aspires to bring its own unique take on the lighting industry. Founded in June 2019, Ujamaa Lighting, specializes residential, commercial, and industrial LED lighting solutions.

products.name: Ujamaa Smart LED Light Bulb
products.description: Our customers spoke, and we listened!  Ujamaa Lighting is proud to introduce our version of the Smart Light.

products.name: #BLACKOUT T-Shirt
products.description: The #BLACKOUT movement was organized to bring awareness to police brutality and racism towards the African-American people. This t-shirt was designed in honor of the efforts to bring peace and equality to Black people worldwide.

products.name: Ujamaa Hoodie (Word Logo - Gold)
products.description: Crafted for comfort, this lighter weight sweatshirt is perfect for relaxing. Once put on, it will be impossible to take off.

30.title: Racial Literacy: What Does it Mean?
30.subtitle: What is your first memory of racial difference? Unfortunately, our education system doesn’t include a standard explanation to our young people of the history of the creation of the concept of race (or critical race theory). Learn today what you should've in school.

30.title: How the Dodgers 'Took' Jackie Robinson | Field of Dreams...Deferred Part 3
30.subtitle: Brooklyn Dodgers executive Branch Rickey signed Jackie Robinson from the Kansas City Monarchs in 1945, but he refused to pay Negro League teams for their players. Watch more on the fight to integrate MLB in "Field of Dreams...Deferred" Part 3.
